channel.title: Building a Music Collection
channel.description:
Okay I don't have an iPod but the radio is seriously pissing me off. All the play is ads and talk way too much. So I would like to make a music collection with the stuff I like that is low maintenance. I really don't want to spend too much time downloading the latest hits. I have the impression that lime wire, while it has lots of music, the music isn't very good and isn't labeled and so on but if you tell me what to look for I could give it a shot. The other alternative is torrents and while they do have an enormous mass of music, most of it I wouldn't really listen to. I guess what I listen to you would call it pop, I really don't know genres.
So how would I go about making such a collection?

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @Frostie21 Frostie21
item.description:
@Frostie21 wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:16, topic:209221”][quote author=Frostie21 link=topic=275584.msg2260086#msg2260086 date=1212559928]
www.dizzler.com - Great way to listen to songs without downloading.

You can also just download the program if you wish and use it as well,instead of going to the site always.
[/quote]
Works great. Got it set up with FrostWire and Amarok.[/quote]

You’re welcome :).

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

On another topic

playlist.com is available in the UK too though

So is last.fm? And it’s better.

Baros Rocks:

If you want to listen to songs before downloading them, can’t you just use youtube?

Youtube sucks balls when you want to listen to music; no looping videos…

item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

No it didn’t. I just need to register an account though. After that I can access it from anywhere but just unable to listen to the music.

If anyone can register an account for me that would be great!

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @R_Y_A_N R Y A N
item.description:
@R_Y_A_N wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:7, topic:209221”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=275584.msg2257576#msg2257576 date=1212413834]
Damn it.

[quote]Dear Pandora Visitor,

We are deeply, deeply sorry to say that due to licensing constraints, we can no longer allow access to Pandora for listeners located outside of the U.S. We will continue to work diligently to realize the vision of a truly global Pandora, but for the time being we are required to restrict its use. We are very sad to have to do this, but there is no other alternative. [/quote]

Trying a proxy.
[/quote]

Did it work?[/quote]for me it does when i tryed using a proxy [ i was curious what they would say] they said something like you live in blabla…and your ip is blabla when i went to pandora without a proxy it was normal though

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Pandora.
It’s a music discovery service in the guise of internet radio. You put in a song or artist that you like, and it searches the Music Genome DB to find songs with similar characteristics. If you like something, you can go find a torrent or even (gasp!) buy it with the convenient Amazon links.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Thats why I said, keep notepad open and when you here a good song you like just write it down then download it call later.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Thing with last.fm is that it is hard to “save the music for later listening”.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Music Collection
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Go to www.last.fm and search for a tag. Then It’ll play a playlist of songs related to that tag. It’s really good.

For example the acoustic playlist is: http://www.last.fm/listen/globaltags/acoustic

Just go to listen, click tag above the search bar and get searching foolio. It’s really good, just remember to keep Notepad open to write down good songs you can download later.

Read full topic
